```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
```


## `pivot_longer`

Load the PULSE data

```{r}
pulse_data = 
  haven::read_sas("./data/public_pulse_data.sas7bdat") %>% 
  janitor::clean_names()
```

Instead of having four different columns for bdi scores, we have df with an ID including a column for visit baseline, 1 month, 6 month, 12 month

Wide format to long format ...

```{r}
pulse_data_tidy =
  pulse_data %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    bdi_score_bl:bdi_score_12m,
    names_to = "visit", 
    names_prefix = "bdi_score_",
    values_to = "bdi"
  )
```
We cleaned the prefix here.

Rewrite, combine, and extend to add a mutate step
```{r}
pulse_data = 
  haven::read_sas("./data/public_pulse_data.sas7bdat") %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  pivot_longer(
    bdi_score_bl:bdi_score_12m,
    names_to = "visit", 
    names_prefix = "bdi_score_",
    values_to = "bdi"
  ) %>% 
    relocate(id, visit) %>% 
  mutate(visit = recode(visit, "bl" = "00m"))
```
